elements.title: Erik Sparre (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Erik Sparre (pictured) is known as "the father of Swedish constitutional law"?

elements.title: The Strange Death of Captain America (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that writer and artist Jim Steranko was given authorship of "The Strange Death of Captain America" in part to resolve a dispute between himself and Stan Lee?

elements.title: Jan Klán (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Jan Klán, as a pilot in the Groupe de Chasse II/5, became the first Czech to achieve an aerial victory against the Luftwaffe while flying the Hawk 75?

elements.title: Oophaga solanensis (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that as part of illegal wildlife trading, Oophaga solanensis frogs are bought for $3 in their native Colombia and sold for up to $1,000 overseas?

elements.title: Kikunosuke Toya (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that before becoming a voice actor, Kikunosuke Toya was the keyboardist of an all-male Princess Princess cover band in high school?

elements.title: was not allowed to ban Sharia law (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the U.S. state of Oklahoma was not allowed to ban Sharia law?

elements.title: has thin clouds that are likely made of nitrogen ice crystals (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Triton, a moon of Neptune, has thin clouds that are likely made of nitrogen ice crystals?

elements.title: Jake Bates (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Jake Bates's first in-game field goal was the second-longest in professional football history?

elements.title: Mum (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that all sea lions in Otago descend from Mum?
